summary: The document is an FBI communication detailing observations of John Roselli, a figure linked to the JFK assassination investigation, at the Friar's Club in Beverly Hills, California, alongside Irving J. Leff, a part-owner of the New Frontier Hotel in Las Vegas, and another individual known as 'Ross'. It highlights activities during the Cuban Missile Crisis, including a surge in firearms and ammunition purchases, and notes Roselli's presence in Miami at that time. The document also contains FBI internal routing and classification details.
key_findings: John Roselli was observed at the Friar's Club in Beverly Hills, California, in October 1962.
Roselli was accompanied by Irving J. Leff and an individual referred to as 'Ross'.
There was a significant increase in firearms and ammunition purchases during the Cuban Missile Crisis.
Roselli was reported to be in Miami during the Cuban Missile Crisis.
This document is included in the FBI's records pertaining to the JFK assassination investigation.
